questions.question: Q1. The purpose of cogging operation is:

answers.a: To reduce the cross-section of the billet
answers.b: To increase the length of the billet

explanations.a: Cogging reduces the cross-sectional area by repeated compressive blows.
explanations.b: As the cross-section reduces, the billet elongates along its length.
explanations.c: Hot working during cogging breaks down coarse grains and improves internal grain structure.
explanations.d: Cogging simultaneously reduces cross-section, increases length, and refines grain structure—hence all statements are correct.

questions.question: Q2. Which of the following shaped billet can be produced by the cogging operation:

explanations.a: Round billets can be formed by controlling die geometry during cogging.
explanations.b: Rectangular or square sections are commonly produced from ingots through cogging passes.
explanations.c: By sequential compression at angles, polygonal sections like hexagon can be produced.
explanations.d: Cogging can generate a wide range of cross-sectional shapes depending on pass schedule and die setup.

questions.question: Q3. What is the advantage of cogging operation:

answers.b: Size of the billet can be reduced
answers.c: Different cross-section shape can be achieved

explanations.a: Cogging is a hot-working process that breaks dendritic grains and improves mechanical properties.
explanations.b: Repeated deformation reduces the billet’s cross-sectional dimension.
explanations.c: Various shapes can be achieved through controlled sequencing of blows and rotations.
explanations.d: Cogging provides all these benefits—grain refinement, dimensional reduction, and shape modification.

questions.question: Q4. The cogging is done at which stage of the metal forming process:

explanations.a: Cogging is the first breakdown operation performed on cast ingots to convert them into workable billets.
explanations.b: Intermediate processing involves rolling or forging, not cogging.
explanations.c: Finishing processes happen after primary breakdown; cogging is not one of them.
explanations.d: Incorrect because cogging is clearly a primary breakdown step.

questions.question: Q5. By cogging operation the ingot is converted into:

explanations.a: Cogging is specifically used to convert large cast ingots into billets for further processing.
explanations.b: Slabs are formed mainly by rolling, not cogging.
explanations.c: Blooms are larger cross-sections; cogging usually aims at billets (smaller).
explanations.d: Sheets are produced by rolling, not by cogging.
